projects.title: AENEAS
projects.description:
The AENEAS project is a H2020 project that runs from 1 January 2017 for three years.

The objective of the AENEAS project is to develop a concept and design for a distributed, federated European Science Data Centre (ESDC) to support the astronomical community in achieving the scientific goals of the Square Kilometre Array (SKA). The scientific potential of the SKA radio telescope is unprecedented and represents one of the highest priorities for the international scientific community. By the same token, the large scale, rate, and complexity of data the SKA will generate, present challenges in data management, computing, and networking that are similarly world-leading. SKA Regional Centres (SRC) like the ESDC will be a vital resource to enable the community to take advantage of the scientific potential of the SKA. Within the tiered SKA operational model, the SRCs will provide essential functionality which is not currently provisioned within the directly operated SKA facilities. AENEAS brings together all the European member states currently part of the SKA project as well as potential future EU SKA national partners, the SKA Organisation itself, and a larger group of international partners including the two host countries Australia and South Africa.

projects.title: INDIGO-DataCloud
projects.description: INDIGO - DataCloud develops an open source data and computing platform targeted at scientific communities, deployable on multiple hardware and provisioned over hybrid, private or public, e-infrastructures. By filling existing gaps in PaaS and SaaS levels, INDIGO-DataCloud will help developers, resources providers, e-infrastructures and scientific communities to overcome current challenges in the Cloud computing, storage and network areas.

projects.title: Clustervision Trinity
projects.description: Trinity is ClusterVision’s cluster management solution. Trinity leverages technologies such as OpenStack and Docker to provide a flexible cluster management tool and bring high performance computing to new users, especially in the life sciences.

authors.headline: Senior Support Engineer at Atlassian - Developer tools
Senior Support Engineer at Atlassian - Developer tools

profile_positions.description:
As a Technical Outreach Expert  I assist the integration of scientific applications with the technical and operational services from EGI (Cloud/Grid/Storage), and ensure that these services as well as community specific services are customised for, and meet the needs of individual researchers, scientific collaborations and emerging European Research Infrastructures. Furthermore, I engage with European-wide projects aiming at strengthening Research and e-Infrastructures, as well as defining the new digital and data skills required from today's research and workforce.

EDISON: Defining the Data Science Profession
° Workpackage leader: Sustainability and Certification of the Data Science Profession
° Task leader: EDISON Online Education Environment

INDIGO DataCloud:
°  Gathering  the data lifecycle requirements from INDIGO DataCloud user communities
°  Defining  Data Management Plans for the user communities 

AENEAS: 
°  Part of task to explore Authentication and Authorization Infrastructure for a European Data Science Center
°  Part of task to explore technologies (Cloud, Grid, HPC) for a European Data Science Center
profile_positions.title: Technical Outreach Expert

profile_positions.description:
At Clustervision, my interests centred on the intersection between High Performance and Cloud computing, specifically how to combine the computational power of HPC, while exploiting the flexibility of cloud infrastructures.  I was part of the development team of Trinity, our HPC-Cloud cluster manager, where I mostly contributed to:

° Software Quality Assurance: software configuration management, testing, test automation, release management at ClusterVision for the Trinity project (High Performance Computing as a Service)
° User Training: training of users and engineers in xCAT and Trinity
profile_positions.title: Quality Assurance Officer

profile_positions.description:
As a Scientific Computing Support Specialist, my goal was to enable researchers to make the best use of the latest computational resources in order to facilitate and advance their scientific pursuits. To achieve this I performed the following functions:

° Technical  review  of  proposals: evaluation and recommendations regarding the  scaling and computational efficiency of proposed workloads
° Task  leader  for  Training: organising workshops and  summer schools, and teaching introductory parallel programming (MPI, OpenMP)
° Task group member for Debugging and Performance analysis:  evaluating debuggers and performance analysis tools
° Benchmarking of codes: evaluating the performance of new machines
° User  support  for  academic  users  of  CSCS:   debugging and performance analysis, following up on system bugs, help tickets
profile_positions.title: Scientific Computing Support Specialist

profile_positions.description: As a postdoctoral research associate at ASU, I worked on a 3D hydrodynamic code to simulate white dwarf collisions. I also developed a code to study the interaction of dust particles with shocks in order to investigate meteoritic chondrule formation.
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Research Associate
